methods.name: locateStaticFieldObjectOnClass
methods.comment:
Locates the field of the name fieldName on the given 
 class.  If the given class does not contain the field, then this 
 method will recursively call up containingClass's 
 implementation tree looking for a parent implementation of the 
 requested field.

params.name: fieldName
params.comment: The name of the field to locate.

params.name: containingClass
params.comment: The class that contains the desired field.

return.comment:
The Field object that matches the given name, or null if not
         suitable field could be found.

methods.name: locateFieldObjectOnClass
methods.comment:
Locates the field of the name fieldName on the given 
 class.  If the given class does not contain the field, then this 
 method will recursively call up containingClass's 
 implementation tree looking for a parent implementation of the 
 requested field.

params.name: fieldName
params.comment: The name of the field to locate.

params.name: containingClass
params.comment: The class that contains the desired field.

return.comment:
The Field object that matches the given name, or null if not
         suitable field could be found.

methods.name: locateMethodObjectOnClass
methods.comment:
Locates the method of the name methodName on the given 
 class.  If the given class does not contain the method, then this 
 method will recursively call up containingClass's 
 implementation tree looking for a parent implementation of the 
 requested method.

params.name: methodName
params.comment: The name of the method to locate.

params.name: containingClass
params.comment: The class that contains the desired method.

params.name: parameterTypes
params.comment: The parameters of the desired method (may be null).

return.comment:
The Method object that matches the given name, or null if not
         suitable method could be found.

methods.name: locateFieldByTypeOnClass
methods.comment:
Get the first field specification contained within containingClass which has the type classType.
 This method is only really useful if it is known that only a single field of 
 classType exists within the containingClass hierarchy.

params.name: classType
params.comment: the class

params.name: containingClass
params.comment: the class that contains a field of the given type

return.comment: field which corresponds to type classType or null

methods.javadoc:
Returns the class name of the entry in the stack that comes before all references to the given classes. This is useful for figuring out at runtime who is calling a particular method.

This method can take multiple classes, but you really only need to pass the oldest class of disinterest. @param classes the classes to ignore @return the desired class name
methods.name: getClassNameOlderThan
methods.comment:
Returns the class name of the entry in the stack that comes before all references to the
 given classes.  This is useful for figuring out at runtime who is calling a particular
 method. 
 
 This method can take multiple classes, but you really only need to pass the oldest 
 class of disinterest.

params.name: classes
params.comment: the classes to ignore

methods.javadoc:
Creates a throwable whose stack trace is based upon the current call stack, with any information coming before, and including, the given classes removed.

This method can take multiple classes, but you really only need to pass the oldest class of disinterest. @param classes the classes to ignore @return the new throwable
methods.name: createThrowableWithStackOlderThan
methods.comment:
Creates a throwable whose stack trace is based upon the current call stack, with any 
 information coming before, and including, the given classes removed.
 
 This method can take multiple classes, but you really only need to pass the oldest 
 class of disinterest.

params.name: classes
params.comment: the classes to ignore

methods.name: movePastStackTracePattern
methods.comment:
Finds the first occurrence of the given pattern and then stops filtering when it finds 
 something that is not that pattern

params.name: trace
params.comment: the trace to update

params.name: pattern
params.comment:
the non-regex patterns used to perform a 
 				  String#contains(CharSequence) on each StackTraceElement line

methods.name: filterStackTrace
methods.comment:
Uses the given patterns to remove elements from the given stack trace.     
 The current implementation will simply perform a toString() on each element and
 then check to see if that string contains any of the patterns.

params.name: trace
params.comment: the trace to filter

params.name: patterns
params.comment:
the non-regex patterns used to perform a 
 				   String#contains(CharSequence) on each StackTraceElement
 				   line.

methods.name: createFilteredThrowable
methods.comment:
A convenience method to create a throwable, filtering any lines that contain the given
 non-regex patterns.  This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces.

params.name: patterns
params.comment:
the non-regex patterns used to perform a 
 				   String#contains(CharSequence) on each StackTraceElement
 				   line.

methods.javadoc:
A convenience method to create a throwable, filtering boiler-plate Java-related 
 lines (e.g., AWT, Swing, Security, etc).  
 This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces with reduced noise.
@return the new throwable
methods.name: createJavaFilteredThrowable
methods.comment:
A convenience method to create a throwable, filtering boiler-plate Java-related 
 lines (e.g., AWT, Swing, Security, etc).  
 This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces with reduced noise.

methods.javadoc:
A convenience method to create a throwable, filtering boiler-plate Java-related lines (e.g., AWT, Swing, Security, etc). This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces with reduced noise.

This method differs from {@link #createJavaFilteredThrowable()} in that this method returns a String, which is useful when printing log messages without having to directly print the stack trace. @return the new throwable
methods.name: createJavaFilteredThrowableString
methods.comment:
A convenience method to create a throwable, filtering boiler-plate Java-related 
 lines (e.g., AWT, Swing, Security, etc).  
 This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces with reduced noise.  
 
 This method differs from #createJavaFilteredThrowable() in that this method
 returns a String, which is useful when printing log messages without having to directly
 print the stack trace.

methods.name: filterJavaThrowable
methods.comment:
A convenience method to take a throwable, filter boiler-plate Java-related 
 lines (e.g., AWT, Swing, Security, etc).  
 This can be useful for emitting diagnostic stack traces with reduced noise.

params.name: t
params.comment: the throwable to filter

methods.name: createStackTraceForAllThreads
methods.comment:
Returns a string which is a printout of a stack trace for each thread running in the
 current JVM

methods.javadoc:
Returns an ordered set of interfaces and classes that are shared amongst the items in the list.

The order of the items is as they are first encountered, favoring interfaces before classes. Further, interface hierarchies are examined before concrete parent extensions.

If the given items have no parents in common, then the result will be a list with only Object.class. @param list the items to examine @return the set of items
methods.name: getSharedHierarchy
methods.comment:
Returns an ordered set of interfaces and classes that are shared amongst the items in 
 the list.
 
 The order of the items is as they are first encountered, favoring interfaces before 
 classes.  Further, interface hierarchies are examined before concrete parent extensions.
 
 If the given items have no parents in common, then the result will be a list with
 only Object.class.

params.name: list
params.comment: the items to examine

methods.javadoc:
Returns an ordered set of parent interfaces and classes that are shared amongst the items in the list.

The order of the items is as they are first encountered, favoring interfaces before classes. Further, interface hierarchies are examined before concrete parent extensions.

If the given items have no parents in common, then the result will be a list with only Object.class. @param list the items to examine @return the set of items
methods.name: getSharedParents
methods.comment:
Returns an ordered set of parent interfaces and classes that are shared 
 amongst the items in the list.
 
 The order of the items is as they are first encountered, favoring interfaces before 
 classes.  Further, interface hierarchies are examined before concrete parent extensions.
 
 If the given items have no parents in common, then the result will be a list with
 only Object.class.

params.name: list
params.comment: the items to examine

methods.name: stackTraceToString
methods.comment:
Turns the given Throwable into a String version of its 
 Throwable#printStackTrace() method.

params.name: t
params.comment: the throwable

methods.javadoc:
Returns an order set of all interfaces implemented and classes extended for the entire type structure of the given class.

If Object.class is passed to this method, then it will be returned in the result of this method. @param c the class to introspect @return the set of parents
methods.name: getAllParents
methods.comment:
Returns an order set of all interfaces implemented and classes extended for the entire
 type structure of the given class. 
 
 If Object.class is passed to this method, then it will be returned in the 
 result of this method.

params.name: c
params.comment: the class to introspect
